2000.context: Cisco Systems, Inc. is a networking and communications technology company focused on network infrastructure, security, and collaboration solutions. Briefly most valuable company during dot-com peak. Router/switch dominance.

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Launched M40 backbone router in 1998, gained 30% of SP market share by 2000

competitors.name: Nortel Networks
competitors.notes: Major rival in network equipment market, distant No. 2 or No. 3 to Cisco in enterprise networking

competitors.name: Lucent Technologies
competitors.notes: Top three competitors in the network equipment market

competitors.name: 3Com
competitors.notes: Enterprise rival competing in routing and switching

competitors.name: Bay Networks
competitors.notes: Formed from merger of SynOptics and Wellfleet, later acquired by Nortel

competitors.name: Cabletron
competitors.notes: Enterprise rival in routing and switching markets

2005.context: Cisco Systems, Inc. is a networking and communications technology company focused on network infrastructure, security, and collaboration solutions. Expanding beyond networking into unified communications and video.

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Biggest rival to Cisco, competed in almost every technology area with widest product overlap

competitors.name: Alcatel-Lucent
competitors.notes: Major domestic competitor alongside Juniper in network infrastructure

competitors.name: Huawei
competitors.notes: Overseas competitor offering full networking solutions for enterprise businesses

competitors.name: Palo Alto Networks
competitors.notes: Started offering cybersecurity products in 2005

competitors.name: Check Point
competitors.notes: Pioneer in cybersecurity established 1993, first company to introduce stateful inspection firewall

competitors.name: HPE Aruba
competitors.notes: Offered wireless solutions, AI-based NaaS, SDWAN, cloud and WAN storage/routing

competitors.name: Arista Networks
competitors.notes: Focused on high-end, high-performance networking devices

competitors.name: Fortinet
competitors.notes: Leading network security solution provider

competitors.name: Extreme Networks
competitors.notes: Focused on networking solutions including wired/wireless networks, SD-WAN

2010.context: Cisco Systems, Inc. is a networking and communications technology company focused on network infrastructure, security, and collaboration solutions. Acquired Tandberg for video. WebEx collaboration. Data center push.

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: 30% share of $643M core routing market in Q2 2010, closest competitor in security markets

competitors.name: Alcatel-Lucent
competitors.notes: Major competitor in carrier edge routing

competitors.name: Avaya
competitors.notes: No. 1 in enterprise telephony with 17% share vs Cisco's 14.6% of $12B market in 2009

competitors.name: Brocade
competitors.notes: Dominated Fibre Channel SAN business with 64% share of $843M market vs Cisco's 36%

competitors.name: Polycom
competitors.notes: Re-tooled in 2010 to better compete against Cisco

competitors.name: HP (Hewlett-Packard)
competitors.notes: Competitor in various market segments

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Competitor in various market segments

competitors.name: F5
competitors.notes: Competitor in application delivery and networking segments

competitors.name: Riverbed
competitors.notes: Competitor in WAN optimization

2015.context: Cisco Systems, Inc. is a networking and communications technology company focused on network infrastructure, security, and collaboration solutions. Software and subscription transition. SDN and intent-based networking.

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Biggest rival to Cisco, competed in almost every technology area

competitors.name: Aruba Networks
competitors.notes: Acquired by HPE in 2015, offered switches and routers with innovative processes

competitors.name: Arista Networks
competitors.notes: Run by ex-Cisco exec Jayshree Ullal, focused on cloud-based networking and data centers

competitors.name: Huawei
competitors.notes: Huge competitor of Cisco's largely outside of the United States

competitors.name: Dell/EMC
competitors.notes: Dell acquired EMC in 2015, merged into 150,000+ employee company

competitors.name: Fortinet
competitors.notes: Leading network security solution provider

competitors.name: Palo Alto Networks
competitors.notes: Became one of biggest cybersecurity players with App-ID technology

competitors.name: Check Point
competitors.notes: Established 1993, pioneer in cybersecurity

competitors.name: Google
competitors.notes: Technology competitor in various IT segments

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Technology competitor in various IT segments

competitors.name: Amazon
competitors.notes: Technology competitor in cloud and IT segments

2020.context: Cisco Systems, Inc. is a networking and communications technology company focused on network infrastructure, security, and collaboration solutions. WebEx saw massive growth. Security and observability acquisitions.

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: American multinational developing and marketing networking products

competitors.name: Arista Networks
competitors.notes: Run by ex-Cisco exec Jayshree Ullal, extended data-center technology to campus and edge

competitors.name: Huawei
competitors.notes: Solid line of networking gear, huge competitor largely outside the United States

competitors.name: HPE/Aruba
competitors.notes: Took big leap into SD-WAN market with $925M acquisition of Silver Peak in 2020

competitors.name: Alcatel-Lucent
competitors.notes: Major competitor in networking infrastructure

competitors.name: VMware
competitors.notes: Competitor in virtualization and cloud infrastructure

competitors.name: Dell
competitors.notes: Controlled 27% of external storage systems market in Q2 2020

competitors.name: Lenovo
competitors.notes: Hyper-converged system sales increased 49% YoY to $72.1M in Q2 2020

competitors.name: Riverbed
competitors.notes: Competitor in WAN optimization and networking

competitors.name: Extreme Networks
competitors.notes: Competitor in networking solutions

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Cloud and technology competitor

2024.context: Cisco Systems, Inc. is a networking and communications technology company focused on network infrastructure, security, and collaboration solutions. Acquired Splunk for $28B. Security and AI networking focus.

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Key competitor specializing in networking products, focus on high-performance networking and automation

competitors.name: Huawei
competitors.notes: Formidable competitor known for cost-effective solutions, significant market share in emerging markets

competitors.name: Arista Networks
competitors.notes: Focuses on high-speed datacenter and cloud networking, products compete directly with Cisco's Nexus and Catalyst switches

competitors.name: HPE Aruba
competitors.notes: Major SD-WAN player with Edge Services Platform analyzing telemetry data

competitors.name: Dell
competitors.notes: Stronger competitor after parting from VMware, has 20,000 data center customers, PowerSwitch supports own NOS and third-party NOSes

competitors.name: Fortinet
competitors.notes: Leading network security solution provider

competitors.name: Palo Alto Networks
competitors.notes: Leading competitor in cybersecurity offering Next-Generation Firewall (NGFW)

competitors.name: Check Point
competitors.notes: Pioneer in cybersecurity with AI-powered cyber protection

competitors.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
competitors.notes: Cloud computing platform offering wide range of services

competitors.name: Google
competitors.notes: Competes across various technology segments

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Competes across various technology segments

2025.context: Cisco Systems, Inc. is a networking and communications technology company focused on network infrastructure, security, and collaboration solutions. AI networking and security integration. Competing with Arista, Palo Alto.

competitors.name: HPE Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Major competitive development: HPE acquired Juniper for ~$14B in July 2025. Provides high-performance networking solutions (routing, switching, security) with heavy investment in AI-based network automation via Mist AI platform. Holds ~10.2% router market share, third behind Cisco and Huawei.

competitors.name: Huawei
competitors.notes: Global telecommunications giant competing in international markets. Cost-effective choice in APAC region, though security concerns and vendor lock-in remain issues. Second-largest router manufacturer globally.

competitors.name: Arista Networks
competitors.notes: Cloud networking solutions provider gaining traction in data center and cloud environments, challenging Cisco's market share in modern infrastructure.

competitors.name: Fortinet
competitors.notes: Serious challenger in cybersecurity, not only in perimeter defense but also in cloud, IoT, edge, and OT security. Named Google Cloud Technology Partner of Year 2025, integrating FortiGate VM and FortiSASE with Google infrastructure. Recognized as leader in IT/OT cybersecurity in 2025 Westlands Advisory report.

competitors.name: Palo Alto Networks
competitors.notes: Leading cybersecurity company with innovation in next-generation firewalls, cloud-native security, and AI-powered threat detection. Holds edge over Cisco through seamless integration of security features in NGFW platform, providing holistic network protection.

competitors.name: HPE Aruba
competitors.notes: Networking solutions including wireless and edge-to-cloud services competing with Cisco's enterprise networking segment. Excellent for Wi-Fi-heavy deployments in education and hospitality sectors.

competitors.name: Dell Technologies
competitors.notes: Through networking solutions and AI server ventures, competes with Cisco in data center and enterprise networking markets.

competitors.name: Alcatel-Lucent (Nokia)
competitors.notes: Telecommunications and networking equipment competitor in enterprise and service provider markets.

competitors.name: HP Inc.
competitors.notes: Networking hardware and enterprise solutions competitor.

competitors.name: VMware
competitors.notes: Network virtualization and software-defined networking competitor, challenging traditional hardware-centric approaches.

mentionedBy.name: Arista Networks

mentionedBy.name: Palo Alto Networks Inc.

Alternative for NGFW, SASE, and cloud security, especially when customers want tight integration with Cisco networking. Strategic acquisitions include Sourcefire (2013) and Duo Security (2018).

mentionedBy.name: Rapid7 Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Kenna's flagship product Kenna.VM is now Cisco Vulnerability Management. Equips organizations with contextual insight and threat intelligence needed to intercept next exploit and respond with precision. Risk-based vulnerability management approach.

mentionedBy.name: Zscaler Inc.
